results.title: My grandfather, the spy
results.brief_description: It was wartime when Edwina’s grandfather met her grandmother. He had a toothache and met his wife to be at the front door. Her father was the local dentist. Edwina tells her grandfather’s extraordinary life story.

results.title: My Grandfather TL
results.creator_credit: Simone Andy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Simone Andy’s fondly recalls her great-grandfather Thomas Lyon or, as he was known, Grandfather TL. A proud, strong Aboriginal man, Grandfather TL fought in the war and finally recieved his medals in 1996. His death in 1989 set Andy on a journey to find out more about her beloved great-grandfather and, ultimately, to find out who she is.

results.title: My grandfather's country
results.creator_credit: Lisa Roberts, Edie Terrick, Poogie Hayes and Elaine Terrick
results.brief_description:
Elaine Terrick’s mum, Edie Terrick, takes a journey back to the place she calls her grandfather’s country - in the mountainous ranges of Gippsland, Victoria. A place where her grandfather survived the slaughtering of his aboriginal people and where he as an abandoned child was found by white people - the O’Rourke family - taken in and brought up as an O’Rourke. For Edie it is an emotional but rewarding journey. Contains beautiful images of the high country and of the “place” where Edi’s grandfather grew up.
Created as part of the “Bute Utes the Movie” project in association with Regional Arts Victoria.

results.title: My friends call me Tony
results.creator_credit: Beverly Shaffer, Kathleen Shannon, Yuki Yoshida and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The film is about a ten-year-old boy who can distinguish only light from shadow. Despite this difficulty, he leads a very active life. The film shows how Tony Rossi manages his life. Awards: Lausanne; Los Angeles.

results.title: My Friend Flicka
results.creator_credit: Harold Schuster, Ralph Dietrich and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A young boy is determined to befriend a rebellious horse in this touching family film based on the celebrated novel by Mary O’Hara. Setting his heart on winning Flicka’s confidence and ultimately taming her, Ken begins to grow up a little and everyone learns some important lessons in this poignant tale of love, patience, faith and ‘hope beyond hope’. Stars Roddy McDowall and Preston Foster.

results.title: My friend Angelmouse
results.creator_credit: Mark Mason, Graham Ralph, Jackie Edwards, Silver Fox and BBC
results.brief_description: Meet Angelmouse, a cheeky and mischievous heaven-sent hero and his many delightful friends in these ten fun-filled adventures. Voiced by David Jason, these charming tales are best suited for children aged 3-5 years. Episodes include: My friend Angelmouse; Lost Thingamajig; Windy weather day; Trumpet; Baby Ellie’s Presents; Angelcake; Copycat chick; Angelmouse’s day off; A Visitor for Angelmouse; Angelmouse’s reward.

results.title: My first year
results.creator_credit: Louise Bryant, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Louise shares her experiences and the three most important lessons she learnt in her first year as a secondary teacher. These are the things they don’t teach you at uni; survival, rewards and pleasant surprises.

results.title: My first science video
results.brief_description: An introduction to the world of science with fifteen simple experiments using everyday materials from around the world. Some of the experiments include making a volcano, making games using magnets and simple electrical and kitchen chemistry experiments.
